The Week Ahead | April 21-27, 2019


The content of this website is currently under review to ensure it is accessible for all of its visitors.

During this process, we look forward to ensuring the highest standards of compliance are met while continuing to provide outstanding customer service.

Meeting agenda packets and other digital documents can be obtained by contacting the City Clerk's Office at clerk@cityofnsb.com or (386) 410-2630.

As always, you can find reasonable notice of upcoming meetings and physical copies of Board, Commission, Committee, and Council agendas posted in the lobby of City Hall located at 210 Sams Avenue, New Smyrna Beach, FL 32168.

Please visit our Website Accessibility page for more information.

 Opens a New Window. 

 Opens a New Window. 

  1. NSB Notices
  1. NSB Notices

  1. Find half-cent sales tax projects with interactive map

    Volusia County’s Public Works Department has developed an interactive map to provide information about city and county projects for the proposed half-cent sales tax initiative. To view the map, go to www.volusia.org/salestax and scroll down. Read on...

  2. Pipe repairs on 400 block of Jessamine Ave scheduled for April 22

    During the excavation and repair of sewer pipe within the 400 block of Jessamine Ave on March 26, two additional sections were identified as in need of repair. This repair is scheduled to occur on Monday, April 22 and possibly Tuesday, April 23. Read on...

  3. Ribbon-cutting ceremony for Phase II of Swoope Boat Ramp set for April 23

    The City of New Smyrna Beach will cut the ribbon on Phase II of Swoope Boat Ramp (2455 Boat Ramp Dr) on Tuesday, April 23 at 9:00 AM. Read on...

  4. Celebrate National Poetry Month at events on April 11 & 25

    The New Smyrna Beach Regional Library (1001 S Dixie Freeway) is planning two events to honor National Poetry Month, the largest literary celebration in the world. Read on...

  5. Tidy up the KonMari way on April 25

    Librarians Julie Chiello and Laura Holton will present the basic concepts and techniques taught in the bestselling book “The Life-changing Magic of Tidying Up” by Marie Kondo on Thursday, April 25 at 2:00 PM at the NSB Regional Library. Read on...

  6. County plans low-impact development workshop on April 25

    Dr. Michael Humphreys will lead a workshop titled “Implementing the Unimaginable: An exploration of effective strategies for environmental change” from 6:00 to 7:30 PM on Thursday, April 25 at Lyonia Environmental Center (2150 Eustace Ave, Deltona). Read on...

  7. City to host annual Arbor Day Celebration on April 26

    The City of New Smyrna Beach will host its annual Arbor Day Celebration at Riverside Park (299 S Riverside Dr) on Friday, April 26 at 10:00 AM. Read on...

  8. FDOT to host public meeting on I-95 Pioneer Trail Interchange on April 30

    FDOT has scheduled an alternatives public meeting for the I-95 at Pioneer Trail Interchange PD&E study, from Williamson Boulevard to Turnbull Bay Road in Volusia County on Tuesday, April 30 at 5:30 PM at the Brannon Center (105 S Riverside Dr). Read on...

  9. Project staging plan for 27th Avenue Beachfront Park playground

    Preparations for the new playground at 27th Avenue Beachfront Park are underway! Pre-construction activity will begin on Monday, March 4 before the entryway from 27th Avenue and 38 parking spaces are closed from March 5 through May 6. Read on...

  10. Improvements along US 1 currently underway

    The Florida Department of Transportation is constructing intersection improvements along US 1 (Dixie Freeway) from south of Smith Street to Julia Street, and on Canal Street from Dimmick Street to Orange Street in New Smyrna Beach, Volusia County. Read on...

  11. State Road (S.R.) 44 South Causeway bridge bulkhead and fender repairs

    The Florida Department of Transportation will be making repairs on the State Road (S.R.) 44 (South Causeway) bridge over the Indian River in New Smyrna Beach. Read on...
/CivicAlerts.aspx

To view public meeting agendas, please click on this link: New Smyrna Beach Public Meetings

The City of New Smyrna Beach is committed to ensuring that all visitors and residents with disabilities, are able to access and use our website, services and participate in municipal activities. Our website offers a diverse range of information and The City of New Smyrna Beach is committed to improving all municipal services for users with disabilities. Please inform us about your experiences, so that The City of New Smyrna Beach may address any deficiencies with our site and improve accessibility going forward. Please contact us using this form to provide input or to request information be provided in an alternative format.
